CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 14, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "YOUNG CRUSADERS - Carrying on a fight for fair employment which too often is ignored by Pittsburgh adults, these members of the local NAACP Youth Council are picketing shoe stores on downtown Fifth Ave., which do not hire Negro salesmen. Shown in foreground with the youngsters are, left to right: John Brice [sic] of the Minute Men Association, Mrs. Dorothy K. Williams, adviser to the youth group, and James McCoy, member of the the local NAACP board. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men and women, including Johnny Grice, James McCoy, Dorothy Williams, and members of NAACP Youth Council, protesting in front of A. S. Beck Shoes with sign reading "We Buy Where We Can Work," Downtown
